results.title: C.F. [Cystic fibrosis]
results.brief_description: We meet children dealing with the common, inherited condition Cystic Fibrosis and they guide us through their particular experience. Also explains how the condition is inherited and passed on from one generation to the next.

results.title: Bylines
results.brief_description: A program that looks inside the Sydney Morning Herald and the staff who put the paper together. “Bylines” takes the audience from the early arrival of the Chief of Staff, through the daily drama of leaks, phone tappings and piracy on the high seas to the convoy of trucks heading into the night with the first edition.

results.title: By the seats of their pants
results.brief_description: When pilot Dick Scobee blasted off aboard the ill-fated Challenger space shuttle, he took with him a unique piece of Australia’s aviation history: a rib from Bert Hinkler’s glider. As Dick’s widow June recounts this same piece was miraculously recovered floating in the ocean amongst the Challenger debris. This programme is a fascinating look at Australia’s aviators. From pioneers such as Sir Charles Kingsford Smith, Charles Ulm and Lores Bonney, through to the pilots of both World Wars and Vietnam, to the barnstorming antics of today’s airmen and women. Experience the thrills of cattle mustering by helicopter in Australia’s wild outback, spectacular aerobatics in a rugged Pitt Special, the life-saving endeavours of the Royal Flying Doctor Service and low-level manoevres by cropduster adventurers. It is a first-hand account from the pilots who were and still are flying ‘by the seats of their pants’.

results.title: By design?
results.creator_credit: Diane O'Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Provides a behind the scene look at the world of fashion. People from Cherry Lane fashion house, “Dolly” and “Mode” magazines and the Australian Wool corporation talk about what is involved in predicting fashions trends, designing, producing garments and putting together fashion.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane O’Connor and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development

results.title: Buzkashi: the national game (D)
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: WARNING: THIS FILM CONTAINS SOME VISUALLY DISTURBING IMAGES Buzkashi is the once forbidden sport performed on horseback by the tribes of Afghanistan. Buzkashi requires incredible riding ability, as the opposing teams battle for a head-less calf. the intense pride and rivalry of a tribal society, as well as the role of physical superiority and competition are implicit. No commentary - natural sound track only.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation

results.title: Buying services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows the need for savings and the importance of investing wisely. Uses the experiences of a young man involved in an automobile accident to illustrate the importance of being financially prepared through having shopped around for the best insurance cover. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buying on credit
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Creative Establishment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows what credit is, how it works and some of the dangers involved in using credit. Uses a conversation between three young men to introduce finance charges, bank loans, downpayment, interest and instalment payments. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buying for long-term use
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows a panel of consumers turning back the clock a year and telling how accurate their predictions have been for major purchases made a year ago. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buying for immediate use
results.creator_credit: Frieda Dejarnette, Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Rates the consumer shopping skills of three young shoppers making typical purchases for immediate use. Illustrates judging quality, price and service and determining which of these factors are valuable in making these purchases. Suitable for upper secondary level.
